qas.question: What is the only spacecraft to visit Neptune?
When did a spacecraft get closest to Neptune?
What near Neptune did a spacecraft visit dangerously close?
What program aired on PBS about Neptune?
What is the only spacecraft to never visit Neptune?
When did a spacecraft refuse to get close to Neptune?
What near Neptune did a spacecraft land on?
What program aired on NBC about Neptune?

plausible_answers.text: PBS all-night program, Neptune All Night

context: <a0_0><b4_0>Voyager 2<b4_0/><a0_0/> is the only spacecraft that has visited Neptune. The spacecraft's closest approach to the planet occurred on <a1_0><b5_0>25 August 1989<b5_0/><a1_0/>. Because this was the last major planet the spacecraft could visit, it was decided to make a close flyby of the moon <a2_0><b6_0>Triton<b6_0/><a2_0/>, regardless of the consequences to the trajectory, similarly to what was done for Voyager 1's encounter with Saturn and its moon Titan. The images relayed back to Earth from Voyager 2 became the basis of a 1989 <b8_0>PBS all-night program, <a3_0><b7_0>Neptune All Night<b8_0/><b7_0/><a3_0/>.
